snippet: Smith & Wesson reported a better-than-expected 61 percent jump in quarterly revenue.
abstract: Smith & Wesson reports third quarter net income of $31.4 million, or 56 cents per share, up from $8.1 million, or 15 cents per share, one year earlier; sales were driven in part by American presidential campaigns and recent shootings raising concerns about stricter gun laws.
lead_paragraph: Smith & Wesson reported a better-than-expected 61 percent jump in quarterly revenue.

headline.print_headline: Gun Maker Says ‘News Events’ Drove Firearm Sales Higher
headline.main: Smith & Wesson Says ‘News Events’ Drove Firearm Sales Higher
